results.title: Room to learn
results.creator_credit: Joyce Chopra and Early Learning Centrer
results.brief_description: Shows an outstanding preschool facility - the Early Learning Center, Connecticut, whose design is based on the Montessori philosophy that the environment of early schooling affects a child’s learning processes over a lifetime.

results.title: Reseeding for better grass
results.brief_description: A film for farmers, explaining how to turn coarse pasture lands into good grazing by ploughing up and re-seeding the land without either a cereal nurse crop or first putting it through a rotation.

results.title: The Mark of Zorro
results.creator_credit: Fred Niblo and Douglas Fairbanks Pictures
results.brief_description: Douglas Fairbanks stars as the unassuming Don Diego de la Vega, son of a wealthy Spanish Californian rancher. Don Diego has a secret identity, for when he dons a mask and cape he is transformed into Zorro. Zorro is the only hope citizens have for protection against the evil Captain Juan Ramon (Robert McKim). Of course, as in all swashbuckling tales there is a pretty damsel involved. Lolita (Marguerite de la Motte), is in love with Zorro but thinks little of Don Diego. To complicate matters Juan Ramon is vying for the affections of the lovely Lolita. Noah Beery Senior plays a supporter of Juan’s until he joins the good guys and aligns himself with Zorro. This is the first of many film versions of Johnston MacCulley’s 1913 adventure story, “The Curse of Capistrano”.

results.title: An Irish Medley 423
results.brief_description: Englishman Reginald Foot plays and sings ten Irish national melodies such as Londonderry Air, Killarney and St Patrick’s Day which are paired with scenes of rural Ireland.

results.title: The Old man and the sea
results.creator_credit: Judd Taylor, Robert E. Fuisz, William F Storke and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: A stunning dramatisation of Hemingway’s epic tale of struggle between man and nature. Anthony Quinn stars as Santiago, whose encounter with a giant Marlin becomes a fight for survival as a band of sharks move in for the kill. Filmed on location on the British Virgin Islands, this film combines action-packed excitement with outstanding human drama.

results.title: Harry the dirty dog
results.brief_description: Harry, a white dog with black spots, enjoys playing in the sprinklers, climbing trees, and especially doing tricks. his first adventure is with an overturned trash can, and eventually he is picked up by a garbage truck and carried to a far away dump. Man adventures later he returns home, a dirtier, wiser dog. Based on the book of the same title by Gene Zion.

results.title: Health habits for a healthy life
results.creator_credit: Ron Casden, James Ganzer and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description: Explains, through animation, the physiological workings of the cardiac, circulatory, and respiratory systems. Outlines and stresses the importance of the pyramid of health, which includes proper nutrition, regular exercise, and social well-being. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: Me depressed?: don't make me laugh
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Christine Mason and Monkey See Productions
results.brief_description: Beneath Spike Milligan’s comedic career lay a severe and debilitating depression, and he is the perfect candidate to present this helpful video on depression and ways of treating it. He speaks with sufferers as well as experts, providing a useful tool for sufferers, family and friends, and health professionals. Included on this tape are; types of depression, the importance of daily activity, charting the rise and fall of moods, controlling negative thoughts, the role of medication, the role of family and friends, suicide, and where to go for help.

results.title: Bull Durham
results.creator_credit: Ron Shelton, Mark Burg, Thom Mount and Mount Company
results.brief_description: Kevin Costner, Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins turn in seriously sexy performances in this sensational baseball comedy. Charged with pulling the Durham Bulls ou of the longest losing streak in Carolina’s Baseball League history, Crash Davis’ (Costner) main challenge is to instruct, insult and inspire Eddie ‘Nuke’ Calvin (Robbins), their indisciplined but bullet-fast pitcher. Sarandon is the team’s groupie-cum-English Lit teacher who becomes the fly in the ointment after she catches Nuke’s eye and begins to distract him from Crash’s tuition with her own slightly bizarre set of off-field rules.
